did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.unittitle: Charles S. Worley, Jr., Collection
did.abstract: The Charles S. Worley, Jr., Collection consist of architectural drawings of designs by Worley, done from the mid-1950s to the early 1960s, with several designs undated. The collection also includes a small group of photographs and negatives of Worley and his own residence in Blacksburg, as well as an extensive collection of slides documenting Worley's student and professional work, work of his students, his travels, nature, and images that were likely used as part of lectures.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from the Charles S. Worley, Jr., Collection must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Charles S. Worley, Jr., Collection, Ms1996-017, Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Charles S. Worley, Jr., Papers, were donated to Special Collections in September 1996.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Charles S. Worley, Jr., Papers commenced and was completed in October and December 1996. An addition to the collection was processed in June 1997. In 2018, a set of slides were located in storage and in June 2019, the collection was reprocessed to include slides and additional architectural drawings found during a collection move around 2010.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Charles Samuel Worley, Jr., was a Professor of Architecture at Virginia Tech from 1947 to 1982 and a Professor Emeritus from 1982 until his death in 1995. He received his B.S. in Architectural Engineering from the University of Oklahoma in 1936 and his M.S. in Architecture from the Illinois Institute of Technology in 1941.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Charles S. Worley, Jr., Collection consist of architectural drawings of designs by Worley, done from the mid-1950s to the early 1960s, with several designs undated. The collection also includes a small group of photographs and negatives of Worley and his own residence in Blacksburg, as well as an extensive collection of slides documenting Worley's student and professional work, work of his students, his travels, nature, and images that were likely used as part of lectures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content: Slide Inventory
scopecontent.p: A spreadsheet inventory of the slide topics, based on Worley's original organization, is available online.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by material type.
